detaileddescription.para: The default value for this parameter is 3000 .

parameterdescription.para: exits if iter>=max_iter (max_iter<0 disables this check).

detaileddescription.para:
Sets Verbosity.
verbose
is a integer number which progressively enables different levels of warning messages or status dump. The larger this value the more detailed is the output.
Adds a (constancy) constraint for the specified frame

The constraint is $ {}^w X_{frame}(q) = {}^w X_{frame}(q^0) $ where the robot configuration $q$ is the one specified with setRobotConfiguration
you should specify first the robot configuration. Otherwise call the versions with explicit constraint value
frameName
the frame name
true if successful, false otherwise.

The homogeneous trasformation of the specified frame w.r.t. the inertial frame will remain constant and equal to the specified second parameter

the transform to associate to the constraint.

simplesect.para: true if successful, false otherwise.

Activate a given constraint previously added with an addFrame**Constraint method.

simplesect.para: In this version of iDynTree, it is not possible to change the nature of the constraint (Full, Position or Rotation) when activating it again.
This method returns true even if the frame constraint was already activate, it only returns false if the constraint was never added.
This method is not meant to be called at each IK loop, and it can increase the computational time of the next call to solve.

parameterdescription.para: the name of the frame on which to attach the constraint
the 4x4 homogeneous transformation to associate to the pose of the constrained frame (r) in the world frame (w), i.e. ʷHᵣ.

simplesect.para: the Span and the MatrixView objects should point an already existing memory. Memory allocation and resizing cannot be achieved with this kind of objects.
true if successful, false otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Activate a given constraint previously added with an addFrame**Constraint method.

simplesect.para: In this version of iDynTree, it is not possible to change the nature of the constraint (Full, Position or Rotation) when activating it again.
This method returns true even if the frame constraint was already activate, it only returns false if the constraint was never added.
This method is not meant to be called at each IK loop, and it can increase the computational time of the next call to solve.

parameterdescription.para: the name of the frame on which to attach the constraint
the pose of the constrained frame (r) in the world frame (w), i.e. ʷHᵣ .

simplesect.para: true if successful, false otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Deactivate a given constraint previously added with an addFrame**Constraint method.

simplesect.para: This method returns true even if the frame constraint was already deactivated, it only returns false if the constraint was never added.

parameterdescription.para: the name of the frame on which to attach the constraint

simplesect.para: true if successful (i.e. the constraint is present) , false otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Check if a given constraint is active or not.

parameterdescription.para: the name of the constrained frame

simplesect.para: true if the constraint is active, false if it is not active or it does not exist, or if the frame does not exist.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string &firstSupportFrame, const Polygon &firstSupportPolygon, const iDynTree::Direction xAxisOfPlaneInWorld, const iDynTree::Direction yAxisOfPlaneInWorld, const iDynTree::Position originOfPlaneInWorld=iDynTree::Position::Zero())
memberdef.name: addCenterOfMassProjectionConstraint

detaileddescription.para: Specialization of addCenterOfMassProjectionConstraint when only two support frames are specified.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string &firstSupportFrame, const Polygon &firstSupportPolygon, const std::string &secondSupportFrame, const Polygon &secondSupportPolygon, const iDynTree::Direction xAxisOfPlaneInWorld, const iDynTree::Direction yAxisOfPlaneInWorld, const iDynTree::Position originOfPlaneInWorld=iDynTree::Position::Zero())
memberdef.name: addCenterOfMassProjectionConstraint

detaileddescription.para: Specialization of addCenterOfMassProjectionConstraint when only two support frames are specified.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::vector< std::string > &supportFrames, const std::vector< Polygon > &supportPolygons, const iDynTree::Direction xAxisOfPlaneInWorld, const iDynTree::Direction yAxisOfPlaneInWorld, const iDynTree::Position originOfPlaneInWorld)
memberdef.name: addCenterOfMassProjectionConstraint

detaileddescription.para: Add a constant inequality constraint on the projection of the center of mass, assuming an arbitrary number of support links.

If a subset of the supportFrames is contrained by a FrameConstraint (both position and constraint) and such constraint is active, this constraint adds a inequality constraint to ensure that the center of mass projection lies on the convex hull of the contact polygons.

Get the distance between the projection of the center of mass projection for the current configuration (set through setRobotConfiguration) and the limit of the convex hull (positive if the center of mass is inside the convex hull, negative if the com is outside the convex hull).
If no constraint has been added through a call to addCenterOfMassProjectionConstraint, return 0.0 .
The convex hull returned is expressed in the plane defined by the xAxisOfPlaneInWorld, yAxisOfPlaneInWorld and originOfPlaneInWorld arguments of the addCenterOfMassProjectionConstraint methods.
The transform world_H_constraintFrame that describe how the support polygon for each support frame is transformed in the world frame are the one set in the addFrameConstraint method.

parameterdescription.para: constraint convex hull for the projected center of mass.

simplesect.para: true if the center of mass projection constraint is active, false otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string &frameName, const iDynTree::Transform &targetValue, const double positionWeight=1.0, const double rotationWeight=1.0)
memberdef.name: addTarget

detaileddescription.para: Adds a target for the specified frame

parameterdescription.para: the name of the frame which represents the target
value that the frame should reach
if the position part of the target is handled as a term in the cost function, this specify the weight of this term in the cost function. Default value is 1.0
if the rotation part of the target is handled as a term in the cost function, this specify the weight of this term in the cost function. Default value is 1.0

simplesect.para: true if successful, false otherwise.

memberdef.name: updateTarget

detaileddescription.para: Update the desired target and weights for the specified frame.

parameterdescription.para: the name of the frame which represents the target
value that the frame should reach
if the position part of the target is handled as a term in the cost function, this specify the weight of this term in the cost function. Default value is the the last one previously set.
if the rotation part of the target is handled as a term in the cost function, this specify the weight of this term in the cost function. Default value is the the last one previously set.

simplesect.para: true if successful, false otherwise, for example if the specified frame target was not previously added with addTarget .

detaileddescription.para: Specify the default method to solve all the specified targets

Targets can be solved fully as cost, partially (position or orientation) as cost and the other component as hard constraint or fully as hard constraints
targetResolutionMode() All the newly added target will have as default resolution mode the one specified in this function. Existing targets will remain unchanged
mode
the target resolution mode
true if successful, false otherwise.
Returns the default method to solve all the specified targets

simplesect.para: setDefaultTargetResolutionMode() All the newly added target will have as default resolution mode the one returned in this function.
the current default method to solve targets

detaileddescription.para: Specify the method to solve the specified target

Targets can be solved fully as cost, partially (position or orientation) as cost and the other component as hard constraint or fully as hard constraints
targetResolutionMode()
mode
the target resolution mode
targetName
the name (frame) identified the target
true if successful, false otherwise, for example if the specified frame target was not previously added with addTarget or addRotationTarget .
Return the target resolution mode

simplesect.para: If the target hasn't been specified yet, it returns "InverseKinematicsTreatTargetAsConstraintNone"
the current target resolution mode, or InverseKinematicsTreatTargetAsConstraintNone if the target cannot be found

detaileddescription.para: Return the last solution of the inverse kinematics problem

This method returns in the shapeSolution variable only the joints that have been optimised viz. only the joints specified in the consideredJoints variable in the initialization
baseTransformSolution
solution for the base position
shapeSolution
solution for the shape (the internal configurations)
Return the last solution of the inverse kinematics problem

This method returns in the shapeSolution variable only the joints that have been optimised viz. only the joints specified in the consideredJoints variable in the initialization
baseTransformSolution
4x4 homogeneous matrix solution for the base pose
shapeSolution
solution for the shape (the internal configurations)
the Span and the MatrixView objects should point an already existing memory. Memory allocation and resizing cannot be achieved with this kind of objects.
true if successful, false otherwise.
private implementation
Default constructor
Destructor

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string &filename, const std::vector< std::string > &consideredJoints=std::vector< std::string >(), const std::string &filetype="urdf")
memberdef.name: loadModelFromFile

briefdescription.para: Loads the kinematic model from an external file.

detaileddescription.para: You can specify an optional list specifying which joints are considered as optimization variables (all the joints not contained in the list are considered fixed joint). If the vector is empty all the joints in the model will be considered as optimization variables.

parameterdescription.para: path to the urdf file describing the model
list of internal joints describing which joints are optimized
(optional) explicit definition of the type of the loaded file. Only "urdf" is supported at the moment.

simplesect.para: true if successful. False otherwise

briefdescription.para: set the kinematic model to be used in the optimization

detaileddescription.para: All the degrees of freedom listed in the second parameters will be used as optimization variables. If the vector is empty, all the joints will be used.

simplesect.para: you may want to simplify the model by calling loadReducedModelFromFullModel method contained in the ModelLoader class.

parameterdescription.para: the kinematic model to be used in the optimization

simplesect.para: true if successful. False otherwise

detaileddescription.para:
Set new joint limits
Yue Hu
jointLimits
vector of new joint limits to be imposed
true if successfull, false otherwise

Get current joint limits
Yue Hu
jointLimits
vector of current joint limits
true if successfull, false otherwise

Reset the variables.
the model is not removed
The parameters such as max iterations, max cpu time and verbosity are resetted with this method.
Sets the robot current configuration

parameterdescription.para: transformation identifying the base pose with respect to the world frame
the robot configuration

simplesect.para: the size (and order) of jointConfiguration must match the joints in the model, not in the consideredJoints variable
true if successful, false otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (iDynTree::MatrixView< const double > baseConfiguration, iDynTree::Span< const double > jointConfiguration)
memberdef.name: setCurrentRobotConfiguration

detaileddescription.para: Sets the robot current configuration

parameterdescription.para: the 4x4 homogeneous transformation that transforms position vectors expressed in the base reference frame in position frames expressed in the world reference frame (i.e. pos_world = baseConfiguration*pos_base).
the robot configuration

simplesect.para: the size (and order) of jointConfiguration must match the joints in the model, not in the consideredJoints variable
the Span and the MatrixView objects should point an already existing memory. Memory allocation and resizing cannot be achieved with this kind of objects.
true if successful, false otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Set configuration for the specified joint

parameterdescription.para: name of the joint
new value for the joint

simplesect.para: true if successful, false otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Sets a desired final configuration for all the robot joints.
The solver will try to obtain solutions as similar to the specified configuration as possible

simplesect.para: the desiredJointConfiguration have the same serialisation of the joints in the specified model

parameterdescription.para: configuration for the joints
weight for the joint configuration cost. If it is not passed, the previous passed value will be mantained. If the value was never passed, its value is 1e-6 .

simplesect.para: true if successful, false otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Sets a desired final configuration for all the robot joints.
The solver will try to obtain solutions as similar to the specified configuration as possible

simplesect.para: the desiredJointConfiguration have the same serialisation of the joints in the specified model

parameterdescription.para: configuration for the joints
weight for the joint configuration cost. If it is not passed, the previous passed value will be mantained. If the value was never passed, its value is 1e-6 .

simplesect.para: true if successful, false otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Sets a desired final configuration for all the robot joints.
The solver will try to obtain solutions as similar to the specified configuration as possible

simplesect.para: the desiredJointConfiguration have the same serialisation of the joints in the specified model

parameterdescription.para: configuration for the joints

Joint-wise weights for the joint configuration cost. This vector should have the same dimension of the desiredJointConfiguration. If one of its elements is negative, the previous value will be kept. If the value was never passed, its value is 1e-6, equal for all joints.

simplesect.para: true if successful, false otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (iDynTree::Span< const double > desiredJointConfiguration, iDynTree::Span< const double > weights)

Joint-wise weights for the joint configuration cost. This vector should have the same dimension of the desiredJointConfiguration. If one of its elements is negative, the previous value will be kept. If the value was never passed, its value is 1e-6, equal for all joints.

simplesect.para: true if successful, false otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Set the directions along which a point will be projected.

simplesect.para: Aiko Dinale (29/08/2017)

parameterdescription.para: vector along which we want to project a point

detaileddescription.para: Given a mechanical structure configuration \[ q \in \operatorname{SE}(3) \times \mathbb{R}^n \] and possibly multiple target frames \[ F_i^d \in \operatorname{SE}(3) \] the inverse kinematics is responsible to find the configuration $ q^* $ such that \[ F_i(q^*) = F_i^d \forall i, \] where the meaning of the $=$ and $\forall$ depends on the resolution mode and on the references specified
Example //Allocateaninversekinematicsobject iDynTree::InverseKinematricik;

simplesect.para: all the cartesian frames must be specified w.r.t. the same global frame. This library does not assume any particular global frame
This class is still in active development, and so API interface can change between iDynTree versions.
